doc.title: Morgan Stanley | RESEARCH
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Chinese Airlines 2Q25 Air China Profitable in Low Season SPA Announced Interim DividendChinese Airlines 2Q25 Air China P_2025-08-29

passages.text: August 29, 2025 12:57 AM GMT

CA, CSA and SPA achieved mild margin expansion YoY mainly on lower fuel prices, but improvements were smaller than anticipated at the start of the year. ... due mainly to a deteriorated demand structure amid macro headwinds. We stay constructive on airlines considering supply- side improvements, and await demand catalysts from improved demand growth and/or improved pax mix. We also focus on industry "anti- involution" dynamics.

Air China reported Rmb238mn net profit for 2Q25, close to the high end of its prelims, while CSA's 2Q25 results were largely in line with prelims. SPA's net profit fell by \(11\%\) , dragged by a higher effective tax rate. Excluding FX, Air China's loss before tax narrowed by \(55\%\) YoY, and CSA and SPA's profit before tax were \(+90\%\) (low base, and excl. impairment from Sichuan Airlines) and \(+10\%\) , respectively. SPA also announced an interim dividend of Rmb0.43 per share, \(35.7\%\) payout, implying \(0.8\%\) dividend yield on its latest closing price.

- OP margin improved by 1.2ppts, 5.1ppts, and 0.3ppts YoY for Air China, CSA, and SPA in 2Q25, respectively, despite pricing pressure, mainly thanks to lower fuel prices, we think.- Pax Yield was down by \(5 - 6\%\) YoY for Air China and CSA in 1H25 and by \(-4\%\) for SPA.- Unit cost (ex. fuel) per ATK: \(+3.2\%\) , \(+0.3\%\) and \(+1.5\%\) YoY for Air China, CSA, and SPA in 1H25, respectively. Air China was affected by higher airport and maintenance costs.- FCF remained under pressure after deducting the lease payment.
Exhibit 1: Chinese Airlines: Results table
Source: Company data. Note: Lease payment of Air China are under Chinese GAAP. PBT ex. FX for CSA also excluded the estimated impairment from Sichuan Airlines.
Source: Company data. Note: Lease payment of Air China are under Chinese GAAP. PBT ex. FX for CSA also excluded the estimated impairment from Sichuan Airlines.
MORGAN STANLEY ASIA LIMITED+
Qianlei Fan, CFA Equity Analyst

We use probability- weighted P/BV multiples: bull case (20% - a higher probability that a faster earnings recovers if industry capacity discipline happens), base case (70%) and bear case (10% - a slight probability earnings are worse than expected due to soft travel demand).
We apply forward 2025e P/BV based on its earnings and ROE outlook: bull case (4.0x 2025e P/BV), base case (2.1x 2025e P/BV), bear case (1.1x 2025e P/BV).
- Yield improvements.- Faster-than-expected domestic or international traffic recovery.- Significant RMB appreciation.- Weakness in crude oil price.
- More negative outlook on traffic demand.- Higher-than-expected loss from Cathay Pacific.- RMB depreciation.

- We use probability-weighted, P/BV multiples, bull case (20% - a higher probability that a faster earnings recovery if industry capacity discipline happens); base case (70%); bear case (10% - a slight probability earnings are worse than expected due to soft travel demand).- We apply forward P/BV to value CSA, based on earnings visibility and ROE outlook.- Bull case 3.0x 2025e P/BV; base case 1.8x 2025e P/BV; bear case 0.9x 2025e P/BV.
- Yield improvements from higher ticket prices.- Faster-than-expected traffic recovery.- Significant RMB appreciation.- Weakness in crude oil price.
- Negative outlook on economy recovery.- RMB depreciation.

- Probability-weighted, P/BV multiples, bull case (20% - a higher probability that a faster earnings recovery if industry capacity discipline happens); base case (70%); bear case (10% - a slight probability earnings are worse than expected due to soft travel demand).- Bull case 4.5x 2025e P/BV, 50% premium to CSA-H; base case 2.3x 2025e P/BV, 30% premium to CSA-H; bear case 1.0x 2025e P/BV, 15% premium to CSA-H. FX rate at Rmb0.96 per HKD.
Risks to Upside- Yield improvements from higher ticket prices.- Faster- than- expected traffic recovery.- Significant RMB appreciation.- Weakness in crude oil price.
Negative outlook on economy recovery. Further RMB depreciation.

Spring Airlines (601021. SS)Probability- weighted PEG ratios: bull case (20% - higher potential to benefit from stronger- than- expected market share gains and price hikes); base case (70%); and bear case (10% - a slight probability of further weakness in 2025- 27, affected by economic slowdown).
Base: 1.1x PEG vs. the 10- year average PEG of 1.1x for the consumer sector, 22% EPS CAGR for 2024- 27e.
Bull: 1.3x PEG, 27% earnings CAGR
Bear: 0.9x PEG, 17% earnings CAGR
Better recovery in international passenger traffic. Lower jet fuel prices. Continued market share gains from full- service carriers.
Negative demand impact from economic slowdown. Significant reduction in subsidies. Higher fuel prices.

Air China Limited (601111. SS)- We use probability- weighted P/BV multiples: bull case (20% - a higher probability that a faster earnings recovers if industry capacity discipline happens), base case (70%) and bear case (10% - a slight probability earnings are worse than expected due to soft travel demand).- Bull case 5.7x 2025e P/BV, 42% premium to H- share; base case 2.6x 2025e P/BV, 27% premium to H- share; bear case 1.2x 2025e P/BV, 13% premium to H- share. FX at Rmb0.96 per HKD.
Risks to Upside- Yield improvement from higher ticket prices.- Faster- than- expected domestic or non- domestic recovery.- Significant RMB appreciation.- Weakness in fuel price.
- Negative outlook worsens on domestic or international demand.- Higher-than-expected loss from Cathay Pacific.- RMB depreciation.

Morgan Stanley uses a relative rating system using terms such as Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated or Underweight (see definitions below). Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold and sell. Investors should carefully read the definitions of all ratings used in Morgan Stanley Research. In addition, since Morgan Stanley Research contains more complete information concerning the analyst's views, investors should carefully read Morgan Stanley Research, in its entirety, and not infer the contents from the rating alone. In any case, ratings (or research) should not be used or relied upon as investment advice. An investor's decision to buy or sell a stock should depend on individual circumstances (such as the investor's existing holdings) and other considerations.
(as of July 31, 2025)
The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm.

For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Data include common stock and ADRs currently assigned ratings. Investment Banking Clients are companies from whom Morgan Stanley received investment banking compensation in the last 12 months. Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Equal- weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Not- Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk- adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk- adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In- Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub- regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
